DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study nulliparous woman undergo induction labor determine whether initiation neuraxial analgesia compare systemic opioid analgesia early labor ( < 4 cm cervical dilation ) affect cesarean delivery rate .
DOC.brief_title: Neuraxial Versus Systemic Analgesia Latent Phase Labor Effect Rate Operative Delivery
DOC.detailed_description: Women early labor frequently request pain medication . Obstetricians may prescribe narcotic ( administer intravenous ( IV ) intramuscular ( IM ) injection ) . However , IV IM narcotic provide incomplete pain relief maternal fetal/neonatal side effect , e.g. , maternal drowsiness , respiratory depression , nausea , vomit , neonatal respiratory depression . Other obstetrician allow patient request early neuraxial ( spinal epidural ) analgesia . The result several study compare patient receive epidural versus IV/IM narcotic labor analgesia ( specifically early labor ) suggest initiation early neuraxial analgesia may associate high Cesarean delivery rate . It hypothesize epidural/spinal local anesthetic may induce pelvic musculature relaxation lead failure fetal descent rotation . However , early pain may marker factor increase risk Cesarean delivery , e.g. , large malpositioned baby , dysfunctional labor . Whether early neuraxial analgesia ( particularly narcotic base , would cause pelvic muscle paralysis ) compare IV/IM narcotic , adversely affect outcome labor study randomized , prospective fashion . The purpose study compare Cesarean forcep delivery rate , quality pain relief , first-time mother undergo induction labor receive neuraxial versus IV/IM analgesia early labor ( cervical dilation < 4 cm ) .
DOC.criteria: induction labor nulliparity > 36 week gestation singleton vertex position cervical dilation < 4 cm first request analgesia desire neuraxial analgesia spontaneously labor multiparity nonvertex presentation > 4cm analgesia request chronic opioid therapy acute opioid therapy within 4 hour analgesia request allergy study drug ( hydromorphone , fentanyl , bupivacaine , lidocaine )
